creditline: The Paul C. Johnson, Jr. Fund
description: thirty small rectangles stapled together; each rectangle has a design or image with pigment and embroidery, including faces, body parts, flowers and abstract designs
medium: Silk, cotton, acrylic, metal, paint; embroidery and painting
text: Mary Bero has long been fascinated by the challenge of creating powerful statements within a small format. Frequently using embroidery and incorporating images of flowers and faces which traditionally convey a tranquil sensibility, Bero's work consistently surprises the viewer with the hard edge of her perspective.
title: Wish You Were Here
